alert.note: Alert for Pine (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Duluth (Northeast Minnesota and Northern Wisconsin)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 25 at 1:47AM CDT by NWS Duluth
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 445 AM CDT EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Pine County. * WHEN...Until 445 AM CDT Sunday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 145 AM CDT Sunday, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1.5 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Bear Creek, Cedar Creek, Mission Creek, Grindstone River, South Branch Grindstone River, Bass Creek, Redhorse Creek, Mud Creek, Kettle River and Snake River. Additional rainfall amounts of an inch or more are expected over the area tonight. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Pine City, Hinckley, Brook Park, Henriette, Beroun and Chengwatana State Forest. - Flood safety information can be found at www.weather.gov/safety/flood.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
